event: encephalopathy characterized by sparse speech and disorientation
vital signs and physical examination were within normal limits
synthetic liver function international normalized ratio, alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, and bilirubin were within normal limits
arterial ammonia was unusually elevated at 204 µmol/L
started on empiric antibiotic coverage with vancomycin, meropenem, micafungin
intravenous micronutrient supplementation for B1, B6, and levocarnitine
lumbar puncture on admission revealed an opening pressure of 8 cmH2O
Gram stain revealed encapsulated yeast suspicious for Cryptococcus
started on liposomal amphotericin B and flucytosine
started on continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT) and rifaximin, zinc, and lactulose
ammonia proceeded to unexpectedly climb to 692 µmol/L
concomitant neurological deterioration necessitating mechanical ventilation
urine and bronchial aspirate was obtained for Mycoplasma and Ureaplasma polymerase chain reaction (PCR)
48 hours after antifungal induction and CRRT, ammonia levels had fallen to <100 µmol/L
repeat lumbar punctures revealed opening pressures greater than 45 cmH2O
permanent CSF diversion was not possible
unable to wean from mechanical ventilation
persistent hydrocephalus, oliguric renal failure, and progressive splenic infarcts with necrosis
magnetic resonance imaging of the brain did not reveal cytotoxic edema
sepsis, duodenal leak, persisting renal failure, and failure to thrive
moved to comfort care in hospice
normal serum citrulline and arginine level
